descriptions: Ever wanted to have a shield and a two-handed weapon without playing some exotic species? Now you can!
Is one shield not enough for you? Now you can have a second, hands-free one!
Have you wanted to use a shield, but aren't proficient? This shield wields itself!
flavor: "The real question is, can they be dual-wielded?" -- Mac

equipment.name: Bow of True Flight
descriptions: The medieval aimbot.
Not all elves are good archers; some of them are just determined cheaters.
Also known as the bow of "those elves are cheating again".
flavor: "It's not cheating! You just don't know how to dodge properly." -- Dresbin

equipment.name: Repeating Crossbow
descriptions: Did I fire four shots or five? Well to tell you the truth, in all this excitement, I kind of lost track myself...
No longer will you have to carry multiple crossbows to make multiple attacks in a round!
It beats having five crossbows hanging off your belt.
flavor: "Unfortunate that it requires a proprietary design of crossbow bolt, though." -- Avaris

equipment.name: Pointy Rune-Covered Staff
descriptions: ...okay, it's a spear, but it's a spear adorned with magic runes that enhance your spells, so don't complain.
Yes, it's actually a spear, but it enhances spell power and isn't that good for stabbing.
Sure, it's a spear. It's ceremonial and useless as a weapon, but the runes on it enhance magical spells.
flavor: "This is an old caster's trick, it makes us look intimidating. And less like squishy wizards." -- Tavila

equipment.name: The War Mage's Compendium
descriptions: Packed full of ways to cause magical destruction, each more exciting than the last.
With each page, you can discover a new, even more exciting way to blow things up.
I bet you thought there were only a few ways to set something on fire. This book proves otherwise.
flavor: "Is that a First Edition? Don't let Uharo see it, I want that for my collection." -- Laurie

equipment.name: Robes of Protection
descriptions: Emblazoned with runes and sigils, it shields even the most excessive mage from the backblast of their own spells.
An essential for overzealous sorcerors everywhere, it mostly protects the user from their own spells.
Complimenting a 'bigger is better' philosophy, one of the robes' features is protection from the caster's own area spells.
flavor: "Perfect, now my fireballs don't need to have a minimum range on them any more." -- Eleri

equipment.name: Amulet of Magic Ability
descriptions: Increases the user's Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma, just to cover all the bases.
Increases your Magic stats, whether you have them or not.
Boosts every magic-related stat, even those used by other systems.
flavor: "What are 'Psi Points', and why do I suddenly have them now?" -- Bradley

equipment.name: Silver Holy Symbol
descriptions: Pure, 100% silver. This makes it both extremely holy, and very malleable, so don't grip it too hard.
Pure silver is both incredibly holy and a highly soft metal, so don't squeeze it during prayer.
Not just silver-plated, but entirely made out of silver. Equal parts holy and malleable so don't clutch it too hard.
flavor: "See, if you surface folk had the sense, you'd make holy symbols from iron like we do." -- Erdan

equipment.name: Brightly Glowing Armor
descriptions: Radiates a divine light upon your surroundings, scaring nearby demons and attracting the attention of everything else.
Emits a pure light that terrifies demons and paints you as a target for everything else in the dungeon.
Glowing with holy power, this armor scares off demons and attracts monsters that collect shiny things.
flavor: "Neville, can you turn down the brightness on your armor, please?" -- Siebel

equipment.name: Encyclopaedia Divinity
descriptions: This gilded tome contains trivia on every deity of every nation and species. It also weighs about sixty pounds.
Guaranteed to ensure you pass every Knowledge: Religion check, and also guaranteed to make you encumbered.
Pro: You'll always be able to answer Religion-related questions. Con: It weighs as much as two cinderblocks.
flavor: "If... I don't make it... then... make Hodge carry this... for laughing at me." -- Mulcahy
"Don't laugh... or I'll... drop this thing... on your head." -- Mulcahy

equipment.name: Holy Grail
descriptions: Not *the* Holy Grail, of course, just *a* Holy Grail, cast in the likeness of the original by knights tired of having to go fetch it all the time.
Not the real thing, but it's an expensive imitation made with real gold, jewels, and unspecified holiness.
It's not the real Holy Grail, but it's still a grail of modest holiness and monetary value.
flavor: "Eh, close enough. The secret to eternal youth wouldn't be much help in this dungeon, anyway." -- Solo

equipment.name: Archaeologist's Fedora
descriptions: Guaranteed to stay on your head while fleeing from rolling boulders and riding minecarts.
Will stay on your head even while you are swimming in water or plummetting down a pit.
Sure to remain on your head no matter how much backtracking or obtuse puzzle-solving you have to do.
flavor: "Isn't this supposed to come with a whip?" -- Narius

equipment.name: Badass Longcoat
descriptions: Wear this, and your enemies will know that you really mean business.
Because you can never have too many pockets.
If you don't want to go the Dramatically Billowing Cloak route, this is an excellent alternative.
flavor: "Sometimes it's just as much about looking the part as it is acting it." -- The Formless

equipment.name: Shoes of Silence
descriptions: Won't scuff, squeak, thud, clomp, or any other form of onomatopaeia.
Muffles the sound of footsteps, squeaky shoes, and the sound of you kicking a door in.
Silences your footsteps, but as a trade-off, causes all tap-dancing checks to automatically fail.
flavor: "They're not in my sssize... I'll get blissstersss!" -- Mardak

equipment.name: Hollowed-out Boulder
descriptions: As long as nobody sees the boulder grow legs and start to tiptoe around, it's the perfect disguise.
Cardboard boxes are too obvious in a dungeon, so hide under a boulder instead.
Just make sure nobody's looking when you tiptoe around while hiding under it, and you'll be fine.
flavor: "Oh, hey, 'dis beats the paper bag for covering up Tal'akh's ugly mug." -- Wyatt

equipment.name: Grey Adhesive Tape
descriptions: This tough roll of a long adhesive strip seems surprisingly useful, somehow.
It's just a gray strip covered with adhesive, and yet, you feel you could accomplish so much with it.
The complement to any crafting project. If the dwarves don't find you handsome, they can at least find you handy.
flavor: "Ah, perfect. The artificer's secret weapon, its usefulness is limited only by one's imagination." -- Avaris

equipment.name: Masterwork Modular Screwdriver
descriptions: It comes with tips for every type of screw in existence, even the discontinued decalobular screws.
Has tips for every screw used in Cordan, even the ones only the Smith On The Mountain uses.
Guaranteed to have a screw bit for every type of screw in Cordan, even the Artificer's Guild patented ones.
flavor: "It's even got the head for those pentalobe screws only used for the Lich King's bone golems!" -- Erdan

equipment.name: Artificer's Monocle
descriptions: Its only special feature is that it can zoom in, but damned if it doesn't make you look suave.
Though its only ability is that it can magnify what you look at, it makes you look refined as well.
Its primary ability is to make you look sophisticated. Its secondary ability is to a zoom function.
flavor: "Man, artificers get all the good-looking gear." -- Rick

equipment.name: Bag of Bits and Pieces
descriptions: Can produce any small screw, nut, washer, or other mechanical part, as long as it's not patented by the Elven Council.
Think of a screw, nut, washer, or other mechanical piece, and this bag will produce it for you, unless it's patented.
Always has the exact tiny part you were looking for, but be prepared to rummage past innumerable other bits to find it.
flavor: "Word of advice - don't try and pull a magnet out of the bag. Trust me." -- Davey

consumables.name: Boom-erang
descriptions: Explodes when it hits something, so don't miss, because you don't want this returning to you.
Easy to throw, but make sure you don't miss and have it come back because it explodes on contact.
Easily thrown, explodes when it hits something - don't miss, because you don't want it returning.
flavor: "I'm guessing it's a statement of confidence in the user's accuracy." -- Ralford

consumables.name: Hollow-Point Javelin
descriptions: The spearhead shatters inside the victim, causing additional damage. Is this good or bad construction? You decide!
The point shatters when it hits the victim, which does extra damage but makes the javelin a single-use affair.
This javelin deals extra damage by shattering inside the victim it strikes, which may or may not be intentional.
flavor: "They're designed to do that? Here I thought Vikari was just throwing them too hard." -- Talrath

consumables.name: Potion of Buffness
descriptions: Makes you incedibly buff, albeit for a short time. Banned from Muscle Man competitions kingdom-wide.
This tonic makes you extremely muscular temporarily, and thus has been banned from Muscle Man competitions.
Gifts you with an impressive set of muscles. Banned from most competitions, so use it while you can.
flavor: "If my muscles get as big as Vikari's, it's not going to make me start talking like him, right?" -- Talon

consumables.name: Fireball Bead
descriptions: A potent magical throwable explosive, because wizards consider grenades too simplistic for their liking.
A throwable, magical explosive. Not unlike a simple grenade, except it's way fancier.
A throwable bead that explodes on impact. Wizards consider grenades too gauche, so they use these.
flavor: "Of course they're better than a ball of gunpowder with a fuse that may or may not go off." -- Marty

consumables.name: Corrosive Bolt Wand
descriptions: Acid or alkali? If it eats through the flesh of your foes, does it really matter?
Might be acid, might be alkali, but either way it does terrible things to exposed flesh.
It doesn't matter if it shoots acid or alkaline bolts, because they both eat through flesh.
flavor: "I feel like I should be wearing gauntlets if I want to use this wand." -- Laurie

consumables.name: Magic-Eating Critter
descriptions: It can easily dispel or negate magical traps or enemies, but then gets too fat and curls up to nap for a few days.
It's adorable, it interferes with magical traps or enemies, and it takes a two-day power nap afterwards.
Cute enough to be a mascot, and effective against hostile magical effects, but sleeps for days to digest magic it eats.
flavor: "Hallo! Is cute little critter! You want crush tiny men with Vikari? Yah? Yah! Hohoho, good critter." -- Vikari

consumables.name: Sacred Pearl
descriptions: Crushing it restores some divine power, and also makes the surrounding are smell of the seashore.
You can crush it to recover divine power and give the area a beach-like scent.
A multipurpose item; crushing it restores divine power, and acts like an air freshener. Sea Breeze scent!
flavor: "Maybe I should save this for the next time we come across a room full of decomposing bodies." -- Narius

consumables.name: Holy Steak
descriptions: It's made from Sacred Cows, of course.
Chock-full of protein, iron, and divine energy. Definitely not sacrilige to eat.
This is what happens to Sacred Cows who stop producing milk.
flavor: "Keep your eyes out for some communion wine to wash this down with." -- Mulcahy

consumables.name: Sanctified Muffins
descriptions: Part of the leftovers from a nearby church's bake sale - but they never go stale.
They never rot or go stale, but unless you're Lawful Good, they taste like dirt.
Left over from a bake sale, they never go stale and the icing is always fresh.
flavor: "I will have to find the recipe for these. They will greatly complement my tarts and pastries!" -- Uharo

consumables.name: Scroll of Tinnitus
descriptions: Causes nearby creatures to hear a ringing sound so annoying, they won't be able to focus on your foosteps.
Subjects nearby enemies to a ringing sound so irritating they can't follow your footsteps even if they tried.
Those in the area of effect will hear nothing but a high-pitched ringing sound. It's cruel but effective.
flavor: "I got hit with one of these once. I almost wanted to stab by ears out." -- Tavila

consumables.name: Wand of Darkness
descriptions: It's not quite as good as invisibility, but the result is the same: nobody can see you.
A substitute for invisibility as long as you don't run into someone with darkvision.
Almost as good as invisibility, until you bump into something that can see in the dark.
flavor: "I prefer these more for getting out over getting in, but that requires not tripping on furniture." -- Aria

consumables.name: Potion of Inconspicuousness
descriptions: Held in a plain, boring phial, drinking this potion will make you look just as plain and boring and not worth bothering with.
This plain and boring potion will alter your appearance to make you look plain, boring, and forgettable.
This potion seems so boring it's not worth your time. The effects of it do the same, giving you free reign to sneak around.
flavor: "Nah, not for me. I'm so amazing that even this potion wouldn't be able to hide it." -- Bradley

consumables.name: Schrdinger's Key
descriptions: It simultaneously opens every door in the dungeon until you use it, at which point it only opens that one.
It works on every door in the dungeon, until you use it, then it only works on that door.
This key can open any door in the dungeon. But only the door that you first decide to use it on.
flavor: "This key is simultaneously in states of being extremely helpful and completely useless." -- Marty

consumables.name: Scroll of Detect Machinery
descriptions: Reveals any and all nearby traps, automatic doors, dwarven mechanisms, and dungeon cleaning constructs.
Outlines any nearby traps, mechanical doors, constructs, and dungeon cleaning dwarfbots.
Exposes the presence of mechanical traps, doors, and trapdoors.
flavor: "It only picks up functioning machinery, which doesn't help if you're trying to find what broke." -- Erdan

consumables.name: Scroll of Create Repair Manual
descriptions: When used on a construct, transforms itself into a complete maintenance guide for it.
Transforms into a complete maintenance manual for the target construct, with index and hardback cover.
Generates a complete maintenance guide to the targeted construct. If none ever existed, the created one is signed.
flavor: "They ain't kidding when they say 'complete', by the way. Hope you know how to skim." -- Davey

consumables.name: Health Potion Concentrate
descriptions: The label says to dilute before consumption, but why bother?
You're supposed to dilute it first, but that hardly seems worth the time.
Technically, you're meant to dilute it, but drinking it straight still works.
flavor: "I'd rather swig a vial than have to chug a whole waterskin in the middle of combat." -- Mac

consumables.name: Scroll of Mend Flesh
descriptions: This energy-agnostic spell can heal living and undead alike, though it does tingle weirdly.
This spell heals both living and undead alike through the power of something unspecified that makes your skin itch.
Able to heal both living and undead, it's unknown what powers this scroll, just that the healing feels slimy.
flavor: "It works, but it feels almost as bad as when you get an itch on a limb that isn't there any more!" -- Narius

consumables.name: Potion of Great Heal
descriptions: It has a normal healing effect, but it just happens to also make you feel great.
So named not because of its potency, but because it leaves you feeling great.
The healing effect is average but it leaves you feeling great afterwards.
flavor: "Maybe I should serve these to my patrons, might make some of them less grumpy. Maybe." -- Karth

consumables.name: Elven Poultice
descriptions: Uses a secret recipe of 11 different herbs, but its effectiveness is undeniable.
Uses so many different herbs it almost seems like it's for culinary purposes at first.
Made of 11 different herbs, not to be confused with the OTHER elven secret that involves 11 herbs and spices.
flavor: "And keep in mind... plant sap smells far better than a festering wound." -- Asira

consumables.name: Wand of Minor Cure
descriptions: Small heal multiplied by lots of charges equals pretty decent heal.
It doesn't heal for much but it has 50 charges left, so it evens out.
Tiny heal x many charges = moderate heal. Just keep poking until the wand is spent.
flavor: "And I can use it in combat, if I pretend I'm playing a drum solo on you." -- Bradley

boss.name: The Fire Elemental
descriptions: A perpetually burning creature taking a somewhat humanoid shape. You're playing with fire fighting this thing.
A humanoid shape made of bright red flames. Don't get burned by being careless.
This column of fire in the vague shape of a person is the third elemental, and a sign that your quest is heating up.
flavor: "You guys remembered to bring mithril arrows, right? I don't think wood is going to help here." -- Talon

texts: Banish it back to the elemental planes!
Lots and lots of ranged attacks!

events.name: Crossfire Trap
descriptions: If one arrow trap is good, multiple arrow traps is even better.
Arrow traps: Why stop at just one?
Whoever built this must have gotten a bulk order discount on arrow traps.
flavor: "And they laughed when I tried to learn how to dual-wield tower shields." -- Talrath

events.name: Double Spear Trap
descriptions: An obvious spear makes you jump out of the way, directly into the second, less obvious spear trap.
The first spear is slow and obvious, to make you dodge directly into the better-hidden spear.
One spear is obvious and slow. It makes you dodge directly into the sharper, more concealed spear.
flavor: "Hey, no fair! Traps aren't allowed to use teamwork!" -- Kirak

texts: Break the spears on a shield.

events.name: Trap Gauntlet
descriptions: A narrow corridor lined with traps spaced in just such a way that there are no safe spots in the whole thing.
No space in this corridor is safe from some trap or other, so keep on moving.
Every step down this corridor triggers another trap, forcing you to move into the path of another one.
flavor: "I can only deflect so many arrows in a short time, you know!" -- Mac

texts: Charge through with a shield up.

events.name: Exploding Rune
descriptions: This sensitive and potent rune can be triggered by reading it, poking it, sneezing on it...
This highly sensitive rune will be set off by rading, proximity, vibration, pressure, or verbal insults.
So sensitive, it can explode if you look at it wrong. It's amazing it hasn't gone off already.
flavor: "You really want me to sing a lullaby for a rune trap?" -- Siebel

events.name: Bitterly Cold Rune
descriptions: Forces you to stop, build a campfire, warm your hands, and complain about the temperature for a little while.
Drops its surroundings to a temperature that's really not that bad, if you're from the frozen north.
This rune makes some party members stop and complain about the cold while others tell them what REAL cold is like.
flavor: "Pfah! Vikari been outside shirtless in colder air than this!" -- Vikari
"This is nothing. I had to shovel two feet of snow just to clear a path from the barracks once. Both ways!" -- Talrath
"Yeah, we get it, and you hiked uphill both ways through the snow, too. I don't care, it's cold!" -- Wyatt

texts: Cancel the rune with a Heat Aura spell.

events.name: Magic Missile Launcher
descriptions: Being assailed by magical bolts is bad enough; it's worse when they can't miss and come ten at a time.
Magic Missile is bad enough on its own, but it's even worse when fired as a salvo.
Magic Missile normally stops at three bolts, and yet, you now have twelve of them hurtling at you.
flavor: "They're even all colored differently. That's dedication. Or is it obsession?" -- Laurie

events.name: Cursed Ring of Copious Bleeding
descriptions: You really shouldn't have picked this up, but at least it wasn't the Ring of You Die.
If you must pick up rings you find on the floor, at least stop putting them on without identifying them.
Have you ever, perhaps, considered identifying jewelry BEFORE you put it on?
flavor: "Great, there's blood everywhere. You're going to attract every vampire in the dungeon." -- Talon
"I did not think one person could actually have that much blood in them. Impressive." -- The Formless

texts: It drained out all my blood!

events.name: Evil Entomology Lab
descriptions: Do you want to try your luck with the spiders, the flying insects, or the flying spiders?
If you don't like insects, this is probably the worst room in the dungeon for you. Sorry.
You know how scorpions are only remotely bearable because they can't fly? Yeah, about that...
flavor: "You know how some insane wizards make chimeras? This is what the druidic equivalent looks like." -- Asira

events.name: That Which Should Not Be Here
descriptions: Don't eldritch abominations have better things to be doing than lurking about in old dungeons?
The only thing worse than an eldritch abomination is an out-of-depth eldritch abomination.
Really, this THING shouldn't even exist in the first place. Nothing should have that many tentacles.
flavor: "Why don't you just wait over by the door and stand *perfectly still* while we solve this?" -- Lyndra

events.name: Giant Animated Stone Hand
descriptions: Get too close, and with a heavy punch it sends you back the way you came, then flips you off.
Step too close and it'll punch you back into the previous room, then flip you the bird.
After it punches you back into the corridor, it'll make offensive hand gestures at you.
flavor: "Some mage heard the phrase 'add insult to injury' and decided to take it literally." -- Laurie

events.name: Delayed Trigger Trapdoor
descriptions: Taking advantage of the common arrangement of adventuring parties, this trapdoor doesn't open until the whole party is over it.
This trapdoor opens a set amount of time after being triggered, allowing time for the entire party to walk over it.
A time-delay mechanism ensures this trapdoor only opens after the entire party is standing on top of it.
flavor: "Look, better that I land on top of you than the other way around." -- Kirak

texts: Find a way around the trigger.
Fall in and climb back out.

events.name: Mithril Caltrops
descriptions: The only reason to make caltrops of mithril is to show adventurers that they're dealing with a high-class villain.
Finding these in a dungeon is how you know you're not dealing with a run-of-the-mill antagonist.
Only the classiest of dungeon lords sees fit to outfit his lair with caltrops of this stature.
flavor: "If we weren't in such a hurry, I'd totally steal and resell these. Or melt them down." -- Talon

texts: Pick a path through the caltrops.
Find a way around the caltrops.
Find a way through the caltrops.
Suck it up and walk across.

events.name: Swinging Blade Trap
descriptions: Take care passing through its arc, or you'll get cut down to size.
It swings back and forth, cutting down slow and clumsy adventurers.
Back and forth, back and forth, back and forth... time this right, or you'll get quite the wound.
flavor: "These are also handy for cutting up roast meats, by the way." -- Erdan

texts: Find a way to turn it off.

events.name: Hand Axe Launcher
descriptions: They're hand axes of returning, too, so don't think you can set it off once and be done with it.
Dodging once is insufficient, as it fires hand axes of returning.
The hand axes are enchanted to return to the launcher, too, so watch your back.
flavor: "Is it still a hand axe if it's launched by a spring? Then again, 'spring axe' doesn't have the same ring to it." -- Tal'akh

events.name: Trapped Door Trap
descriptions: The door trap is obvious. The trap that springs when you try to disarm THAT trap is better hidden, and much deadlier.
The door has an obvious trap, but when you try to disarm it, it springs a second, nastier trap.
It's easy to spot and disarm the trap on this door, but doing so triggers another hidden and much deadlier trap.
flavor: "I knew it. This place has so many traps, even the traps are trapped." -- Narius

events.name: Portcullis
descriptions: The mechanism is broken, so someone will have to muscle up and lift it.
The chain to raise it is broken, so you'll have to just lift the thing manually.
Unfortunately the mechanism is busted, so you'll have to force it open.
flavor: "Who uses a portcullis indoors anyway? Doors are better; you can kick 'em in for a dynamic entry!" -- Rick

texts: Pool together and stuggle to lift it up.
Give up and find another path.

events.name: Pillar Rolling Puzzle
descriptions: Somehow they don't stop rolling until they hit something, and then stop instead of rolling back.
The pillars only move when you push them, but then keep moving until they hit something no matter what.
These weird pillars cannot be stopped once you push them, until they hit a wall or another pillar.
flavor: "Typical. Some wizard figures out how to negate friction, and wastes it on a stupid puzzle." -- Hodge

texts: Combine your strength to push the pillars.

events.name: Platforming Section
descriptions: It goes without saying that if you screw up at all, you'll fall all the way down to the bottom.
And of course, one mis-step, and you'll have to start over again from the bottom.
An enchantment prevents you from taking damage if you fall, but you'll have to start over again if you do.
flavor: "This is hard enough already, why do some of these platforms have to be slippery too?" -- Mac

events.name: Rune of Dancing
descriptions: Causes your party to break out into a perfectly synchronized (but time-consuming) rendition of a famous performance.
Forces your entire party to break into a song and dance routine. It's harmless, but time-consuming.
You thought you didn't know how to dance, but apparently, you do, and now you can't stop.
flavor: "We are all fortunate that I was given the vocals, rather than our throaty sword-wielders..." -- Siebel

texts: You can tap-dance in greaves? Wow!

events.name: Teleportitis Trap
descriptions: Funny how 'random' teleporting never takes yuo in the direction you want to go, isn't it?
Inflicts 'random' teleportation on you for a while that will never take you in a helpful direction.
Causes you to periodically teleport in a 'random' direction that always takes you further from your destination.
flavor: "I'm just waiting for it to dump me into a trap or a pile of monsters, and then never trigger again." -- Tal'akh

texts: Wait it out and come back.

events.name: Rune of Dancing
descriptions: Causes your party to break out into a perfectly synchronized (but time-consuming) rendition of a famous performance.
Forces your entire party to break into a song and dance routine. It's harmless, but time-consuming.
You thought you didn't know how to dance, but apparently, you do, and now you can't stop.
flavor: "We are all fortunate that I was given the vocals, rather than our throaty sword-wielders..." -- Siebel

texts: You can tap-dance in greaves? Wow!

events.name: Spa & Sauna
descriptions: Don't judge adventurers for trying to stay beautiful! Adventuring is rugged work.
Hey, that Charisma score isn't going to maintain itself.
It's also conveniently divided: Men, Women, and Constructs.
flavor: "About time I got the chance to get all of this blood off of me." -- Aria

texts: It's just an illusion! Break its effect!
It's just an illuion, ward against it!

events.name: Bargaining Demon
descriptions: It's not trying to make you sell your soul, but instead to rent it out to the Infernal Realms in a time-sharing scheme.
Sell your soul? No, no, that's so last year. It just wants you to rent it when you're not using it as a time-share...
Nobody falls for the 'sell your soul' trick any more, so this demon is trying to con you into a time-share of your soul instead.
flavor: "Did mortal salesmen adapt this sales pitch from hell's legions, or was it the other way around?" -- Neville

texts: Keep telling it no until it leaves.
Avoid sales traps until it leaves.
Send the demon back where it came from.

events.name: Desecrated Ground
descriptions: It's covered in bones, rotting vegetation, evil energy, and dark purple light sources.
The area has been decorated with skulls, candles made from human fat, nasty curses, and edgy posters.
This room has been defiled by unholy energy, rotting corpses, poison mushrooms and sweaty gym clothes.
flavor: "Sometimes I wonder if the first thing necromancers sacrifice isn't their soul, but their sense of smell." -- Eleri

events.name: Three-Dimensional Labyrinth
descriptions: Some things just weren't meant to progress to the third dimension.
The addition of an extra layer makes this incredibly frustrating.
This maze requires you to go up and down in addition to left and right, making it infinitely more confusing.
flavor: "Drawing a map for this thing isn't any easier than trying to solve it in the first place, you know." -- Kirak

texts: Will the right-hand rule even work here?
Keep trying paths until you find the right one.
Find a way through the maze.

events.name: Combination Lock
descriptions: Whatever crazy species made this apparently counts from 00 to FF because that's what the dial is labelled in.
This dial goes up to 99, and then just keeps counting in some weird arcane glyphs.
The dial on this lock includes fractions and imaginary numbers for extra frustration.
flavor: "Who locks a door with one of these things?" -- Marty

texts: Brute force the... no, just go around.

events.name: Tar Trap
descriptions: It'll dump a bucket of feathers on you afterwards, just to add insult to injury.
Not only is it really disgusting, it takes FOREVER to get off of your gear.
Comes with a complimentary feather trap that shares the same trigger.
flavor: "You think you have it tough? Imagine trying to get tar out of the joints of plate armor." -- Talrath

texts: Ick, it's all over my clothes!
Get it off, get it off!

events.name: Multicolored Brick Wall
descriptions: Every single brick on the wall is a different color, so good luck figuring out which one is the secret door trigger.
You can't look for the one odd-colored brick that triggers a secret passage because every brick is a different color.
This entire wall is made of bricks that don't repeat the same color twice, removing the easy way of finding the secret passage trigger.
flavor: "It is doubly ingenious and/or insane because it hurts to even look at such a mash of colors." -- Avaris

events.name: Circuitboard Puzzle
descriptions: Hope you remember how logic gates work, or you'll be at this for a while.
Yes, it is a bit of an anachronism, but since when did that ever get in the way of a good puzzle?
Binary logic has been around forever, allowing formal logic and obtuse puzzles to be created.
flavor: "What the heck is an XNAND supposed to be? Are we sure this uses binary logic?" -- Solo

texts: Keep trying stuff until it works.

events.name: Disassembled Clockwork Mechanism
descriptions: This time, all the gears are the same size and have different numbers of teeth. Don't get your fingers crushed!
This iteration of the classic puzzle-obstacle features cams in addition to gears with different numbers of teeth.
And for this time around, the gears all have different shapes of teeth and sometimes require chains to connect them.
flavor: "This reminds me of when I saw a construct get disemboweled. Gears and oil everywhere!" -- Volkur

texts: Replace the gears in the right spots.

monsters.name: Lizard Wizard
descriptions: Dangerous enough on his own, but he has a Skunk Monk as a bodyguard.
If that's not bad enough, he's got an Leopard Bard to back him up.
He'd be tough by himself, but he's also got a Taurus Magus as a cohort.
flavor: "Hey, this guy owes me 20 gold! Get him!" -- Tal'akh

texts: Nail both with a cone of cold.
Line up a lightning bolt to hit both of them.
Throw one of them at the other.
Pick one of them up and hit the other with him.
Hit one and send them flying into the other.

monsters.name: Junk Mimic
descriptions: What you thought was just a random bit of trash on the floor suddenly grew tentacles and a set of sharp teeth when you passed it.
As if your day couldn't get any worse, you just got attacked by a discarded potion phial and the hilt of a broken sword.
You know the dungeon is out to get you when a discarded scroll case suddenly grows tentacles and attacks you.
flavor: "I can't believe I have sunk so low as to be attacked by a freakin' water bottle." -- Wyatt

texts: Blast it with a cone of fire.
Burn it up in a flame pillar.

monsters.name: Succubus Adventurer
descriptions: Normally adventurers wearing the equivalent of a leather two-piece swimsuit for armor get ridiculed, but in this case, it actually makes sense.
Finally, someone for whom it actually makes sense to wear what amounts to a leather two-piece swimsuit.
She's dressed in what basically amounts to a bikini made of leather, which actually makes sense to be on a succubus.
flavor: "I remember when I used to wear armor like that. Those were not good times." -- Eleri

texts: Send her back to the Infernal Planes.
Toss her out of the room.

monsters.name: RoboDwarf
descriptions: A mighty dwarf whose soul was bound to a machine likeness after his death that, just like his organic body, is powered by alcohol.
Holding the spirit of a dwarven warrior, who still survives off alcohol even in his machine form.
When a mighty dwarven warrior fell, they rebuilt him - they had the technology. He still runs off alcohol.
flavor: "Actually, they say he was so deep in debt that they revived him so he could do mercenary work just to pay it off." -- Mulcahy

texts: Turn him - it still counts as necromancy.
It's still technically necromancy, so smite him.

monsters.name: Orcish Brawler
descriptions: He's got a mean right hook. And a mean left hook. And a mean kick in the ribs, and a mean headbutt, and...
He's not unarmed, he's dual-wielding big meaty green fists.
The important distinction between a monk and a brawler is that a brawler is more than happy to take cheap shots.
flavor: "Imagine fighting me, except with arms like tree trunks, and I always punched below the belt. That's this guy." -- Mac

texts: Hit him when he drops his guard.

monsters.name: Spider-Throwing Deep Elf
descriptions: Why would someone build this character?!
Whichever player made this character is no longer allowed at the gaming table.
The player who made this character has been banned from the campaign.
flavor: "We'll see how much you're laughing after I've shoved those spiders down your throat!" -- Hodge

texts: Drop on him and stab him.
Knock the spiders back at him.

monsters.name: Gryphon
descriptions: All the vicious murderous tendencies of a cat combined with a beak that can remove organs. Attempting to pet it is ill-advised.
Someone decided it was a good idea to combine a large cat's murderous instincts with talons the length of daggers.
It has all the murderous bloodthirst of a cat, with the serrated beak and knife-length talons of a large bird. Stay clear.
flavor: "They're better mounts than horses, but they're more tempermental, and falling off of one is far worse." -- Laurie

texts: Set a trap for it to fly into.
Set off a trap when it comes near.
Shoot it out of the air.

monsters.name: Kobold Mad Scientist
descriptions: They laughed at him, said he was crazy, until he built a catapult that launches armed bear traps at people.
Nobody took him seriously, nobody cared who he was... until he invented the cluster land mine.
Nobody took notice of him, everyone ignored him, until he built a gatling gun that launched fireballs.
flavor: "This is why you shouldn't underestimate us. On a completely unrelated note, I'd like a raise." -- Kirak

texts: Set one of his traps at him.
Turn one of his golems on him.
Break his traps, then break his face.
Fire arrows past all his traps.

monsters.name: Floral Slime
descriptions: This slime entices adventurers into devouring range by smelling better than the rest of the dungeon.
Many adventurers have been lured into the slime's range since it smells better than everything else in here.
It's quite common for cunning adventurers to fall prey to the one thing in this dungeon that doesn't smell awful.
flavor: "Even though it wants to eat us, I believe this is one of the least objectionable creatures we have encountered." -- Avaris

monsters.name: Ancient Mummy
descriptions: Say what you will about those ancient civilizations, but even their corpses were built to last.
Back in the day of ancient civilizations, even their corpses were made to last for centuries.
Ancient civilizations were made to last - their buildings, their roads, even their corpses.
flavor: "Call me old-fashioned, but I prefer my ancient history stationary, and not trying to curse me." -- Bradley

texts: Mummies hate fire. Use all the fire.
Fiery Wave to light it up like a torch.

monsters.name: Gryvern
descriptions: Gryphon + Wyvern. Spits acid, is always grumpy, and eats metallic items. Banks use them to remove old coins from circulation.
A hybrid of a wyvern and a gryphon (a hybrid of a bird and a cat). For all your recursive hybrid needs.
A gryphon/wyvern hybrid. It likes to laze around in warm spots but will spit acid if you try to pick it up.
flavor: "Because gryphons weren't bad enough, now it has armor plating and acid breath. Fantastic. Not." -- Hodge

texts: Get behind it and flip it over.
Zap it with a lightning bolt.

monsters.name: Fallen Druid
descriptions: Too many mosquito swarms have caused this druid to renounce his faith in the beauty of nature.
This once-devout druid has renounced his faith after dealing with jumping spiders.
Dealing with giant hornets has made this druid recant his oaths; "Nature is awful!"
flavor: "A follower of nature must be prepared to accept all of her creations... as long as they stay out of my bedroll." -- Ralford

texts: Get the drop on him while he's monologuing.
Fireball him and all his wooden equipment.
Incendiary Cloud him, and his wooden gear.
Blast him and his wooden armor with a cone of fire.

monsters.name: Man-Eating Plant
descriptions: Despite the name, this plant eats people indiscriminate of gender, age, or species.
Not as picky as the name suggests; it'll eat men and women indiscriminately.
Don't be fooled by the name, as it will eat anything organic regardless of physical or mental gender.
flavor: "I have seen druidic orders ring their groves with these... they keep out trespassers quite well." -- Asira

texts: Lure its tendrils into a blade trap.
Set a trap and lure its tendrils into it.

monsters.name: Treasure Golem
descriptions: A cruel trick played on adventurers, as most of the treasure has to get damaged or destroyed to stop the golem from attacking.
Though an impractical creation despite the heaviness of its blows, it's mostly a practical joke on adventurers who have to destroy it.
Though not a weak golem, it purpose is primarily to play a trick on adventurers, who have to damage the treasure it's made of.
flavor: "And don't think of trying to pull it apart. They are made to explode when you do that, because the creator hates you." -- Avaris

texts: Blow it apart with a Sonic wave.
Blast it apart with a wave of force.
Tear it apart with a force blast.

monsters.name: Eldritch Alchemist
descriptions: Writer of numerous heinous recipe books, he roams the dungeon looking for ingredients to That Which Must Not Be Brewed.
Wearing black robes stained with numerous chemicals, he is scouring the dungeon for The Unbrewable Horror.
His potion flasks seem to contain black tentacles and he mutters under his breath about The Great Old Brews.
flavor: "I bet he's part of the Cult of CthulBREW. Heh heh. Aw, come on, that was a good one." -- Tal'akh

texts: Sneak behind him while he's mumbling.
Ward from acid and eldritch things.

monsters.name: Evil Coordinator
descriptions: This middle-manager for the Forces of Evil has a very busy schedule of mayhem and chaos to get to, so don't keep him busy for long.
Despite his busy schedule, this middle-manager from the Forces of Evil can pencil you in for a beatdown, but only for a few minutes.
A middle-manager from the Forces of Evil. He's skipping part of his lunch break to fight you, so don't take too long.
flavor: "I've heard rumors that their screening process involves measuring the caliber of your maniacal laughter." -- Karth

texts: Sneak up while the rest of the party distracts him.
Shank him while he's checking his schedule.
Call down divine wrath on him.

monsters.name: Amalgamate Monstrosity
descriptions: It's a disgusting blob with about fifty mouths, all of which are screaming in a different pitch. It's almost as bad as a daycare.
An ooze adorned with mouths that do nothing but scream constantly. It's almost as bad as running a daycare center.
This disgusting blob leaves a trail of slime and is covered in mouths that scream unceasingly. It's not unlike being around a newborn baby.
flavor: "I SAID, SOMEONE CAST AURA OF SILENCE BEFORE I GO INSANE, PLEASE!" -- Narius

texts: Let it set off a trap (as you run with your hands over your ears).
Paralyze it so it shuts up.
Hold Monster to make it shut up.
Banish it to another plane, any plane.

monsters.name: Multicultural Zombie Horde
descriptions: Features zombies of many races, species, and skin/scale colors for maximum diversity.
Made up of zombies from a variety of races and species by an equal-opportunity necromancer.
A very well-travelled necromancer must have collected bodies from numerous countries to make this.
flavor: "This must have been done on a bet. Why else would there be a zombie mermaid?" -- Siebel

texts: Lure them across a trap. One that resets.
Lure them to a really big pit trap.
Set off the hall full of traps when they chase you into it.
Turn Undead the front half so they trample the back half.

monsters.name: Dwarven Manhack
descriptions: An enchanted, hovering orb of whirling death from masterwork mithril +1 blades. Explodes when destroyed just to stop you looting it.
A magical hovering orb covered in whirling blades that's been enchanted to always aim for the face.
An enchanted orb that's half clockwork and half whirling sharp blades, that just wants a hug.
flavor: "I once built something like that to chop all my vegetables!" -- Davey

texts: Hit its weak spot with a thrown weapon.
Jam the right blade to it tears itself apart.
Find the right way to jam its blades.

monsters.name: Shade
descriptions: This floating creature of darkness would be almost undetectable if not for the ominously glowing yellow eyes.
A creature made of shadows and darkness that thankfully also has a pair of glowing eyes to negate its own camouflage.
An ominous, glowing pair of eyes rather defeats the point of this creature being made entirely of shadows.
flavor: "The biggest danger with these things is stepping on one while they're sleeping. They bite. Don't ask how." -- Tavila

texts: Distract it and stab it from behind.
Set off a fire trap to brighten the place.
Trigger a flame trap for illumination.
Find a fire trap to light up the area.

equipment.name: Ridiculously Oversized Sword
descriptions: So... compensating for something, huh?
You know, the size doesn't matter as much as how you use it.
This won't make you any more of a man, you know that, right?
flavor: "That you were even able to lift it off the ground is, quite frankly, astounding." -- Avaris

equipment.name: Axe of Bisection
descriptions: If you have a problem, use this axe. Then you'll have two halves of a problem, and that rounds down to zero problems.
Turn a big problem into two small not-problems with a mighty swing of this enchanted axe!
If a monster is in your way, use this axe to make it into two half-monsters that are not in your way.
flavor: "Just be careful swinging that thing around - we don't need you to split the party with it." -- Talrath

equipment.name: Whip of Laceration
descriptions: Made out of bladed chains and with a flail on the end, it's quite likely whatever gets hit by this will die of blood loss before anything else.
A length of bladed chains adorned with a flail on the tip just to truly ensure that this is one Bleeding effect the enemy can't ignore.
This whip uses a multitude of bladed chains with a bladed flail tip to take advantage of the fact that Bleeding can stack with itself.
flavor: "I'm going to stand well away from whoever decides to wield this. Don't cut yourself to ribbons, now." -- Dresbin

equipment.name: Musket
descriptions: Wait, this campaign is using firearm rules?!
Wait, this setting has guns? Since when?!
We're using early firearm rules? Why didn't anyone say anything?!
flavor: "Tch! It's heavy, takes forever to reload, is ruined by water... these things will never catch on." -- Tal'akh

equipment.name: 101 Incendiary Spells
descriptions: Learn the hottest mage tricks and become a trailblazer with these inflammatory incantations!
Read this sizzling tome to add some spice to your spells and take yourself on a hot streak!
Turn up the heat and make your foes sweat with these gloriously incandescent incantations.
flavor: "Oooh. Gimme. There was a copy of this in the Restricted Section of the college's library." -- Eleri

equipment.name: Mage Counsellor's Staff
descriptions: Property of the Magic Council. If found, return to the Magic Council Head Office, City In The Sky, Floating Continent, 7743-A1A6.
This staff once belonged to a member of the Magic Council. You should return it when you're done, but in the meantime, use its power.
This staff is glowing and humming faintly with the amount of magical power it contains. Finders keepers!
flavor: "I would like to earn one of these legitimately some day, but I can pretend in the meantime." -- Laurie

equipment.name: Archmage Robes
descriptions: Archmage is a brand name in this case, but they are still very high-quality garments stitched with arcane runes.
That's Archmage, the brand name. That said, they're still well-made and infused with enough magical power to glow at all times.
Not to be confused with Archmage's Robes, these are robes sold under the Archmage brand. They're still very high quality at least.
flavor: "I always wanted some of these, but they never make them in my size, and they clash with my boots." -- Volkur

equipment.name: Scepter of Magical Convenience
descriptions: Although its capacity is finite, it usually recharges fast enough to have just enough energy for whatever if is you're trying to do.
It technically has a limited capacity but always seems to have -just- enough to do whatever it is you're trying to do.
This staff always has enough magic to do whatever it is you're trying to do - just barely enough, every single time.
flavor: "Maybe if I remind it that the fate of all Cordan is in our hands, it'll become even more powerful." -- Marty

equipment.name: Staff of Religious Tolerance
descriptions: The symbols of all major religions dangle from this staff as a symbol of cooperation between churches. Jangles loudly whenever you move.
In a sign of cooperation between numerous churches, this staff is adorned with symbols of all of them. It's very crowded.
All the various major religions contributed towards making this staff, which is why it is covered in symbols from every last one.
flavor: "It's both a favored weapon of my deity and a profane tool of my sworn enemies. I have mixed feelings." -- Neville

equipment.name: Deific Reference Compendium
descriptions: Everything you ever wanted to know about the gods, but were afraid to ask.
Contains detailed information - and embarrassing secrets - about all the various gods.
The ultimate source of divine information, be it legitimate background or mocking descriptions of rituals.
flavor: "Give it here, I know you children would immediately want to look up the rituals of the fertility goddess's followers." -- Mulcahy

equipment.name: High Priest's Robes
descriptions: Care instructions: Hand wash in holy water only.
These delicate robes instill the wearer with divine power, as long as they are properly washed.
The height of fashion (from about a century ago) and comes with its own ridiculous hat.
flavor: "I just know the next thing we encounter after I put these on is going to be some awful slime creature." -- Erdan

equipment.name: Blessed Chain Whip
descriptions: Who knew that whips were so good at destroying vampires?
One vampire hunting family started the tradition of using whips, and it caught on for some reason.
It's a one of a kind item because every single chain in the length was blessed individually.
flavor: "These are particularly effective against the newest vampires. They can't handle something that sparkles more than they do." -- The Formless

equipment.name: Ninja Garb
descriptions: Enhances your jumping and running ability at the cost of forcing you to brood dramatically in poorly-lit areas every few minutes.
This light gear is made to allow you comfortably and quickly run, jump, and brood in front of a sunset.
Expertly made and of the highest quality, this clothing is made to let you run, jump, and stand on top of buildings with a dramatic backdrop.
flavor: "No, look, monk clothes and ninja clothes are completely different. Even if they serve the exact same purpose." -- Mac

equipment.name: Bundle of Kunai
descriptions: Useless as weapons but great for throwing into dark corridors as a distraction or to set off traps. Also decent gardening tools.
Glorified gardening tools that are actually terrible weapons. The serve far better as distractions, pitons, and letter openers.
Despite depiction in the media, kunai are useless as weapons, unless you try and poke someone's eye out with one.
flavor: "You can kill with these if you have imagination. I killed someone with a soup spoon once." -- The Formless

equipment.name: Sandals of Stealth
descriptions: Lighter and without all the stiffness of leather. The only sandals it is acceptable to wear socks with.
Lighter than boots and easy to slip on, these are the only sandals you should wear socks with - just make sure they're dark.
You're allowed to wear socks with these sandals, as long as they aren't bright white, plaid, argyle, or otherwise conspicuous.
flavor: "You go ahead and take those flimsy things. I shall keep my steeltoed boots." -- Talrath

equipment.name: Belt of Roll Dodging
descriptions: Everyone knows that roll dodging is the fastest and most efficient form of transportation.
Because there's no faster way to get around than to roll dodge.
Walking is for chumps. Get ahead of the pack by roll dodging to your destination today.
flavor: "Yeah, I'm just gonna say it: it may be faster, but you look like a complete freakin' moron doing that." -- Wyatt
"Hup! Hah! Hoah! Ho! Hup! ...ugh, man, this is really tiring." -- Narius

equipment.name: Dwarven 3D Printer
descriptions: Who needs to bother bringing spare parts when you have one of these?
Its convenience can't be matched, but only the elders of the dwarven council know how it works.
At least this one's still full; the mithril powder cartridges cost more than the printers themselves.
flavor: "Heck yes, I've been looking for one of these for years. Let's try not to fall into any water pit traps now, y'hear?" -- Davey

equipment.name: Orb of Telekineis
descriptions: Mechanical tasks are way easier when you can have the equivalent of ten pairs of hands working on them at a time.
Ever wanted to be able to fix that thing without having to get out of your chair? Now you can!
If you've ever felt like you've never had enough hands while working on something, this is the item for you.
flavor: "I can also use it to push on pressure plates from a distance before you bumblers rush ahead and set them off." -- Volkur

equipment.name: Throwing Spanner
descriptions: Guaranteed to bring any nonmagical mechanism to a halt - just throw it in!
Throw it into the works of any machine and it'll bring the whole thing to a halt.
As it turns out, the phrase "Throw a spanner in the works" was based on a true story.
flavor: "Do not throw it at one of my constructs, or I shall be forced to throw one of my nonmagical wrenches at your head." -- Avaris

equipment.name: Mithril Multitool
descriptions: Wrench, pliers, screwdriver, hammer, measuring tape, and more - and it weighs about as much as a single tool would.
A foldable set of tools that fit into your pocket, weigh as much as one tool normally does, and are distractingly shiny.
A super lightweight tool set that folds up into a pocket-sized slab of metal. Loved by rich folks and noodle-armed craftspeople.
flavor: "Careful you don't take one of your fingers off folding it back up, though." -- Rick

consumables.name: Beef Cake
descriptions: Not nearly as tasty as it sounds but packed with enough protein to bulk you up in a hurry.
In this case, a Beef Pie would have been unquestioningly superior, but it's still packed with protein.
Of all the things that beef can be served in, a cake is not recommended. At least it's still chock full of protein.
flavor: "Look, I'm partial to eating raw meat on occasion, and even I won't touch that." -- Kirak

consumables.name: Performance Enhancing Potion
descriptions: You might as well; the monsters are probably drinking this stuff too.
If it's any consolation the monsters are all consuming this stuff as well.
Hopefully it improves your combat performance, and not, you know, your other performance.
flavor: "I shall hold off on my lecture about the evils of potion abuse, as this one might just save us all." -- Neville

consumables.name: Home Cooked Meal
descriptions: Just like grandma used to make, before you doomed your hometown by becoming a protagonist adventurer.
You used to be able to get these in your hometown before you became an adventurer and doomed it.
A delicious home cooked meal like your family made before your nemesis killed them to give you a tragic backstory.
flavor: "Yep, just like my ma used to make... with way too much salt." -- Wyatt

consumables.name: Fireball Bead Chain
descriptions: You could wear it as a necklace if you get a thrill from potentially exploding when someone hits you.
If you want to live life on the edge, wear this: The magical equivalent of a string of grenades.
Just because you CAN wear a string of impact-sensitive magical explosives doesn't mean you SHOULD.
flavor: "I mean, there are worse ways to go than in a chain of explosions, but this just seems reckless." -- Eleri

consumables.name: Dwarven Firewater
descriptions: Later on in history, the dwarves will be recognized for being the first people to process oil into gasoline, and then drink it.
Whatever this stuff is made out of, not only does it taste awful but it burns *really* well.
Proof, if any more were needed, that the dwarves will drink just about anything if it has alcohol content.
flavor: "And the dwarves get mad at us for not drinking 'real booze'?" -- Lyndra

consumables.name: Magic Brownie
descriptions: No, like, literally magic. Not "magic". The secret ingredient is mana.
That's the literal kind of magic, as in, arcane powered. Not, you know... "magic".
That is, a brownie infused with thaumaturgic power. Not intoxicating plant substances.
flavor: "For the last time... just because I am a druid, does not mean I can supply you with 'herbs'." -- Asira

consumables.name: Scroll of Status Effects
descriptions: Whoever gets hit with this gets poisoned, blinded, deafened, stunned, disarmed, confused, slowed, [37 more]
The unfortunate victim of this scroll will be cursed - along with 43 other negative status effects.
Inflicts poison, deafness, insanity, bad luck, cursed, doomed, wrickets, depression, obesity, homesickness, coulrophobia...
flavor: "Hitting someone with both Frozen and Burning seems at worst pointless and at best completely overkill." -- Mulcahy

consumables.name: Potion of Pure
descriptions: "Potion of Pure -What-?", people ask. Nobody's ever gotten an answer, but whatever it is, it's effective.
Nobody quite knows what noun was supposed to come at the end of this potion, but it's certainly effective.
The effectiveness of this potion is widely known; whatever was supposed to suffix the 'Pure', however, is not.
flavor: "Pure energy? Pure orange juice? Pure evil? Pure alcohol?" -- Laurie

consumables.name: Scroll of Divine Fire
descriptions: An obvious case of magical plagiarism, it's just Fire Wall except the flames are white and do Radiant Damage instead.
First, the wizards invented the Column Of Flame spell. Then, the clerics stole it and made this, and it still hits like a flaming truck.
The Incendiary Pillar spell was so effective that the divine casters stole it and made their own version.
flavor: "This is far better against an undead horde anyway; you don't get that charred flesh smell." -- Siebel

consumables.name: Wand of Distraction
descriptions: It's actually just a rod of gold. Throw it, and your foes will rush to go grab it and ignore you.
This stick of silver has no magical properties whatsoever, but if you throw it, your foes will run after it greedily.
Sure, it's just a rod of gold, but you can guarantee that any patrols that see it will immediately rush over to it.
flavor: "This is another fine case in the argument that riches CAN solve all your problems." -- Tavila

consumables.name: Disguise Potion
descriptions: It disguises you AS a potion. But, potions are small and easy to miss in a dark dungeon, so it works out well.
The Disguise Potion makes a Potion Disguise. This makes you very small and easy to miss in a dark dungeon.
Disguising yourself AS a potion doesn't seem that useful, but remember that potion vials are tiny and hard to see in the dark.
flavor: "Seems like an awful lot of work to go to compared to just, you know, invisibility." -- Talon

consumables.name: Scroll of Garishness
descriptions: Your outfit will be altered to such a hideously clashing array of oclors and styles that even oozes will recoil in horror and look away.
This scroll alters your outfit to such bright and awfully clashing colors that every monster will glance away and pretend you don't exist.
The effects of this scroll cause your outfit to become so intensely gaudy that even zombies will shield their eyes and look away, ashamed for you.
flavor: "I don't think this works on the nobility though - they'll just assume it's the latest fashion." -- Bradley

consumables.name: Bag of Thermite
descriptions: Hoarded by the dwarves for centuries, this incendiary compound is guaranteed to destroy any mechanical trap you light it near.
This ancient dwarven secret, finally revealed, is guaranteed to destroy any machine you light it on. And part of the floor, too.
Guaranteed to destroy any trap you light it on, melt the wall it's set into, and burn a hole into the floor underneath it.
flavor: "I strongly recommend not attempting to start a campfire with this. Burned food will be the least of your concerns." -- Uharo

consumables.name: Dwarven Electromagnet
descriptions: Burns out after one use but it's bound to rip -something- important out of the nearest trap or construct.
Generates a field so powerful it'll rip apart a nearby construct, and then burn itself out.
Tears apart machines and constructs with ease. Caution: Do not point at party members in full plate.
flavor: "Please let me get out of the way before you use this. Losing my arm once was bad enough." -- Narius

consumables.name: Electrostatic Throwable Potion
descriptions: EMP grenades are anachronistic to the setting, so here's the next best thing.
Pretty much just an EMP grenade that's appropriate to the setting.
Generates a powerful electromagnetic field that ruins constructs and metal traps, and is definitely not just a reskinned EMP.
flavor: "These infernal things not only ruin constructs, they'll also make your hair stand on end." -- Avaris

consumables.name: Fairy in a Bottle
descriptions: "Please let me out!" it cries, "I'll heal you if you do, just set me free!" Better keep hold of it for later.
Some cruel person has stuck a fae creature into this tiny bottle. Let it out and it will heal you. Better hang onto it.
This fairy has been stuffed into a bottle to make it so desperate to escape it will heal whoever releases it.
flavor: "I feel like we ought to release it, but on the other hand, I wouldn't want the healing to go to waste..." -- Solo

consumables.name: Potion of Stop Dying
descriptions: Even orc shamans are capable of brewing excellent substances, they just can't name them properly.
This blunt name is an indicator that it was brewed by an orc shaman; its potency indicates it was one of the few good ones.
A masterful orc shaman brewed this potent concoction. He named it so his followers would comprehent what it does.
flavor: "It's not as if orcish is a terribly prosaic language to write item descriptions in, anyway." -- Ralford

consumables.name: Hero Sandwich
descriptions: The secret ingredient is a Potion of Heroism mixed into the honey mustard sauce.
Enchanted tomatoes, elven wayfarer bread, smoked dire boar ham, and a Potion of Heroism mixed into the honey mustard sauce.
Edible perfection made from only the freshest ingredients, toasted just right, and with a Potion of Heroism in the sauce.
flavor: "Anybody have a knife - that hasn't been used to stab something today - to cut this with?" -- Dresbin

consumables.name: Scroll of Regeneration
descriptions: Causes wounds to rapidly clot, scab, scar over, and mend within seconds. Sounds and looks awful, but works amazingly well.
Induces the normal healing process, but at a rapidly increased pace. Saves you having to tear off a band-aid.
Speeds up the normal healing process to finish in a matter of minutes. Clean the wound first, or you'll see a high-speed infection too.
flavor: "Knock it off, stop staring. It's bad enough already that my flesh is making noises at me." -- Hodge

consumables.name: Miracle Cure
descriptions: A green herbal paste that smells, feels, looks, tastes, and even sounds awful - but heals wounds within seconds of application.
This paste is an affront to all four-to-six senses, depending on your species and racial abilities, but it works amazingly.
The potency of his herbal paste is the stuff of legends. Unfortunately, so is its offense to all of the senses.
flavor: "Don't complain... if your wounds get infected, they will look and smell far worse than this." -- Asira

boss.name: The Earth Elemental
descriptions: An animated group of stones and boulders arranged in a humanoid appearance. If you're not careful, you're going to get rocked.
A vaguely humanoid cluster of rocks, pebbles, sand and boulders. It's slow but if you fail to dodge it might grind you to dust.
Rocks, sand, dust, and more rocks form this humanoid-shaped elemental. Its attacks hit like a ton of bricks.
flavor: "Now we're officially between a rock and a hard place." -- Tal'akh

texts: Rip it apart with a force wave!
Banish it to the elemental planes!
Block its attacks and strike back!
Break its rocks until nothing's left!

events.name: Ballista Trap
descriptions: When an arrow trap just isn't enough.
Take it up a notch from arrow traps, and you have this.
Arrow traps not cutting it? Try a ballista trap, and give those pesky adventurers what for.
flavor: "When they break out the miniaturized siege equipment, they're getting serious." -- Rick

texts: Stop the bolt on a shield.

events.name: Swinging Fullblade Trap
descriptions: At this point the traps might as well be swinging steel support beams at you.
Just in case you weren't impressed by the two-handed sword trap on the previous floor.
Designed by the trapmaker who followed the "go big or go home" philosophy.
flavor: "No wonder the corridor got so wide at this point." -- Erdan

texts: Parry the sword (and then regret it).
Stop the sword on your shield.

events.name: Animated Floor Tiles
descriptions: Because everything here is trying to kill you: these tiles rise up from the ground one at a time and fly directly at your face.
Many of the floor tiles in this room will slowly rise, one at a time, then fling themselves at your face out of spite.
A case of even the room trying to kill you, the floor tiles here rise into the air one by one before flying straight towards your face.
flavor: "What next? Walls that throw bricks at us? ...I've jinxed it now, haven't I?" -- Talrath

texts: Smack the tiles out of the air.
Hit the tiles away with your weapon.

events.name: Cluster Rune
descriptions: When triggered this rune creates more runes in a circle around it. Then, they all explode.
This rune is actually made up of several smaller runes, that all explode individually when triggered.
This rune's primary effect is to create many smaller runes. The secondary effect is to make all of them explode.
flavor: "I'd tell you to stand back, but with the way this thing works, it won't matter." -- Marty

events.name: Flash Freezing Rune
descriptions: Freezes you, Blinds you, and Stuns you for good measure, on top fo the d12s for damage dice.
That is, a flash and a freeze, so that you're both blinded and frozen. And down a bunch of hitpoints.
Freezes you in the blink of an eye. Also blinds you in the blink of an eye. And damages... you get the picture.
flavor: "The trap is also set up so that if you make any cold-related puns, it detonates immediately." -- Laurie

events.name: Rune of Infighting
descriptions: This trap mimics your party member's voices to hurl insults, issue challenges, and start political debates.
A powerful illusion trap that uses the voices of your party members to hurl insults and political opinions.
If undetected, this rune mimics the voices of those nearby to start political arguments that invariably end in fisticuffs.
flavor: "Maybe you humans would have better foreign relations if you stopped making 'Monster Manuals' that list entire species as Always Evil." -- Tal'akh

events.name: Scarab of Death
descriptions: Now you know why you might not want to use the "Take All" button when examining a loot pile.
Just in case you wondered why you might want to not use the Take All action at a loot pile.
If you survive, consider it a lesson in why you shouldn't use the Loot All option on corpses.
flavor: "We should've had The Formless pick it up, I'm pretty sure he doesn't have a heart for it to burrow into." -- Hodge

texts: Get it off get it off get it off!
Remove C-... uh... never mind, Resurrection.

events.name: Obligatory Sewer Section
descriptions: Hah! And you thought you'd go a whole adventure without one! Hold on to your noses.
Sucker, you thought you could go an entire adventure without one.
You should have seen it coming; it's required by law for every adventure to have at least one.
flavor: "People really have gotta stop building these absurdly spacious sewers." -- Wyatt

texts: Hold your breath, if you can.
Protection from You Don't Want To Know.

events.name: That Which Has No Description
flavor: "There are worse eldritch horrors, but trying to describe it would be pretty maddening." -- Neville

events.name: Dwarven Land Mines
descriptions: One of the many reasons the Fortress of Uru-Kazungi has never been entered, even by its own staff.
The Fortress of Uru-Kazungi has never been broken into because of these. Even by its own staff.
The dwarven Fortress of Uru-Kazungi is surrounded by these, which is why nobody has ever set foot in it. Even the dwarves.
flavor: "Watch your step. No really. Keep your eyes on the ground, you daft lads." -- Karth

texts: Spot the mines and lead the way.

events.name: Dark Room Full Of Pits
descriptions: A foul magic prevents any light being cast in this room, ensuring many embarrassing plunges through holes in the floor.
Try as you might, this room cannot be lit by mundane or magical means, so step carefully.
Various magical enchantments prevent you from bringing light here, so listen out for your allies falling down pits.
flavor: "I am immediately suspicious of any plan involving me walking at the front." -- Narius

events.name: Low-Height Swinging Blades
descriptions: Too low to block with a shield, you'd better jump right if you trigger one or risk losing a couple feet.
These are too low to be blocked by a shield, so here's hoping you know how to jump.
Positioned at just the right height to make a shield impractical, hopefully you brought armored pants.
flavor: "No, I did not bring enough full-plate armor for everyone, and it would not fit you anyway." -- Talrath

texts: Locate and avoid the trigger plates.

events.name: Flamethrower Trap
descriptions: Were the walls of this corridor always made from melted stone?
Taking advantage of the fact that most adventurers wear flammable clothing.
Did you remember to bring your asbestos undergarments today?
flavor: "Wish I'd brought some more meat along in my rations, we could have had a cookout!" -- Davey

events.name: Sawblade Launcher
descriptions: This deadly trap can also be repurposed for long-range forestry projects.
Attempting to block these is highly unrecommended. Especially with a wooden shield.
Initially used for taking down trees from a safe distance, it was quickly repurposed for nefarious traps.
flavor: "Actually, we came up with these when the elves tried to send the treants after us." -- Kirak

events.name: Electrified Metal Door
descriptions: Nothing seems to be amiss with this door, until you turn the handle.
This door seems perfectly willing to be opened until you touch it.
This metal door only has a cheap lock, but that's not the reason it's still closed tight.
flavor: "Now see, this is why you want to wear non-conducting boots and gloves in a place like this." -- Davey

texts: Ground the door to render it harmless.

events.name: Bombproof Metal Door
descriptions: This little piggy built his house out of steel girders and reinforced concrete.
Someone has caught on to your mages' penchant for solving problems with explosions.
Normally this would be total overkill, but your party seems to routinely apply explosions to solve their problems.
flavor: "It can't be blown up? Well, I'm out of ideas." -- Eleri

texts: Tear the door off its hinges.

events.name: Botched Block Puzzle
descriptions: Someone screwed up the puzzle before you got here, and it doesn't reset when you leave and re-enter the room.
This would be easier if someone hadn't messed up the puzzle before you arrived.
Naturally, this type of puzzle doesn't reset when someone enters the room, and someone else screwed it up already.
flavor: "Didn't the king make it illegal to have puzzles like this with no reset feature?" -- Laurie

texts: The puzzle's screwed, just break down the door.
Don't bother fixing it; just break down the door.

events.name: Long Vertical Shaft
descriptions: How do they make the platforms float in midair? Why do the critters just fly back and forth horizontally? We may never know.
A series of gravity-defying platforms and flying critters that serve as such are your only way up.
The only way up is to jump on mysterious floating platforms and flying flat-topped critters. Hope you didn't skip leg day.
flavor: "You'll have to carry me. Your armor alone is heavier than me, so don't complain about it." -- Lyndra

texts: Throw the lighter party members up.
Jump, and pull up the noodlier party members.

events.name: Frozen Room
descriptions: Ugh. Ice Physics!
Oh no, not Ice Physics.
Just when you were least expecting it - Ice Physics!
flavor: "Come on, you gotta admit, watching them flail about on the ice is *hilarious*." -- Wyatt

texts: Slide back and forth for a while.
Skid around until you reach the other side.
Slip and slide until you reach the door.
Heat the room to melt the ice.

events.name: Teleporter Labyrinth
descriptions: It's nearly impossible to map and the teleporters make you queasy every time you take them.
Made all the more annoying by an extended teleporting animation slowing you down.
This would be easier if most of the rooms weren't completely identical.
flavor: "I'm starting to be convinced that the dungeon architect is a sadist." -- Tavila

texts: Keep trying teleporters until you get out.
'Adjust' one of the teleporters to go where you need.
Calculate the correct path of teleporters.

events.name: Cutscene Trigger
descriptions: Trigger it, and you'll be locked in place for several minutes listening to exposition.
Don't get too close or you'll be frozen in place during a panoramic view of the room.
Careful; set it off, and you'll have to listen to hamfisted Light and Dark morality tales for the next ten minutes.
flavor: "You mean I DON'T have to listen to people telling me how much they like swords?" -- Wyatt

texts: Just trigger it and move on.
Don't bother trying to avoid it.

events.name: Lucrative Sidequest
descriptions: Just head back to the dungeon entrance to pick up a minor item for this fetch quest and earn a legendary item!
Go fetch 30 slorm gems and 50 flabble nuts for a reward!
Go kill 100 of the infinitely respawning minor monsters to feel good about yourself and get a reward!
flavor: "Guys, we can do the sidequest after the main one... hey! Come back!" -- Mac

texts: It's just a trap! Break the enchantment!

events.name: Highly-String Salesdemon
descriptions: Free delivery! Extended warranty! Just listen to these testimonials! But wait; there's more! Sell one soul, get credit for two!
Bael Mays here with a whole variety of high-quality Legendary demonic items that can be yours for this low, low price!
Is your soul old and tainted by sins? Don't worry! We'll give you the best deal for your old soul when you trade it in today!
flavor: "These demons are relentless. Shouting at me won't make me buy your stuff!" -- Dresbin

texts: Send it back where it came from.

events.name: Medusa Lair
descriptions: If the dungeon master ever describes statues as "incredibly lifelike", it's time to equip your petrification protection items.
The dungeon master never describes statues as being extremely lifelike unless they're actually petrified people.
The "eerily lifelike" statues in horrified poses are a dead giveaway, every time.
flavor: "I'd bet 50 gold that "It can't petrify ALL of us!" were the last words of one of these sets of statues." -- Bradley

texts: Smite it from around the corner.

events.name: Recursive Maze
descriptions: It's a big maze made up of other, smaller mazes, some of which have tiny mazes and puzzles inside.
Some sections of the maze are smaller, self-contained mazes, and some of those have puzzles in the middle.
Each section of the maze is actually a smaller maze, and has a puzzle at the exit.
flavor: "I think the architect stole the designs of existing mazes, glued them together, and called it new..." -- Tavila

events.name: Corridoor
descriptions: A hallway of nothing but doors featuring every type and variant of mechanical lock known to dwarf.
It's a long hallway with a door every five feet, and every one of them has a different type of lock.
Behind each door is another door, each with a different type of lock. When does it end?
flavor: "I've seen home improvement stores with fewer doors than this hallway." -- Davey

events.name: Sneezing Gas Trap
descriptions: This definitely violates some kind of treaty about cruel and unusual dungeon traps.
This trap has to be illegal under the laws about cruel and unusual traps.
Whoever installed this is clearly ignoring the standards on cruel and unusual traps.
flavor: "Now see, had only you thought to wear a mask like mine, you wouldn't be in this predicament." -- The Formless

events.name: Deceptively Long Corridor
descriptions: There's no reason anyone would build a corridor this long if it didn't have a secret door in it somewhere.
Any passage this long with no other features has to be concealing a secret passageway.
Nobody ever digs a corridor this long without hiding a secret passage near the middle.
flavor: "It's dwarven tradition to put secret rooms in these corridors, mostly for hiding ale casks." -- Volkur

events.name: Nested Puzzles
descriptions: Solving the pushable block puzzle reveals the solution to a room full of levers that exposes a 15-tile puzzle...
Complete the weight-balancing puzzle to reveal a torch-lighting puzzle that unlocks the pushable blocks...
The tile-rotating puzzle leads to a color-matching puzzle that itself reveals riddle...
flavor: "Be quiet for once and let me think - the rest of you can get back to smashing things soon." -- Volkur

events.name: Broken Plumbing
descriptions: Reconnecting them all up properly opens the way. Connecting them improperly results in a sewage shower.
The novelty of this puzzle stems from the fact that if you screw it up, you'll be sprayed with sewage.
Fix the pipes to proceed; get it wrong for a copious showering of sewage.
flavor: "Are you SURE this is the right solution? Are you sure you're sure? Don't open the valve if you have ANY doubts." -- Aria

texts: Keep trying pipes until it works.
Very, very carefully find the solution.
