boss.name: BOSS #5
descriptions: DESCRIPTION 1
DESCRIPTION 2
DESCRIPTION 3
flavor: FLAVOR TEXT

events.name: Gatling Arrow Trap
descriptions: Poking your head around the corner to check if they've stopped seems very unwise.
It really works better than it ought to, especially in a narrow corridor when you're travelling in a group.
You can always substitute quality for quantity, for some sufficiently large value of quantity.
flavor: "I'd rather face an elven marksman than a bunch of random arrows aimed at nothing." -- Wyatt

texts: Run to the next safe spot.

events.name: Swinging Katana Trap
descriptions: They are, as any dungeon builder will tell you, just simply better than sword traps.
Expertly crafted, many-layered folded steel... wasted on a hallway trap. Who did this?
When a regular sword trap just doesn't cut it any more, it's time to upgrade to one of these.
flavor: "Next time I encounter a sentient sword that's a jerk, I'll threaten to do this to it." -- Hodge

events.name: Animated Wall Section
descriptions: You know it's going to be a bad day when the wall starts spitting bricks at you.
Who's throwing bricks?! Oh, the wall is alive and throwing parts of itself at you.
Animated snowmen throw snowballs. Animated wall sections hurl bricks at your head. Duck!
flavor: "Maybe if we wait it out, it'll run out of bricks and fall apart." -- Laurie

events.name: Recursive Explosion Rune
descriptions: The pyromaniac who inscribed this loved explosions so much, he wanted even his explosions to explode.
When one explosion just isn't enough for you, make the explosions explode when they're done exploding.
Why stop at just one explosion, when you can keep on exploding?
flavor: "It works better than you'd think. The second exploions scatters debris from the first." -- Eleri

events.name: Arcane Riddle Trap
descriptions: It's simple: Answer some random bit of arcane trivia, or eat a Maximized Cone of Cold.
Answer the riddle and you may pass; fail and you get to enjoy a high-end Life Drain to the face.
This arcane spell is eager to hand out prizes. Answer its riddle to win passage; fail to win 10d6 sonic damage.
flavor: "So, in other words... it's a regular magic trap, with a voice command to disable it." -- Marty

texts: Does this riddle even have an answer?

events.name: Imploding Rune
descriptions: An affront to traditional magic everywhere, this anti-explosive rune generates a gravity pulse that can crush bones.
A recent fad, as far as most mages are concerned, but it still has the power to crush bones.
Considered almost heretical by traditional casters, this rune counters explosions with a bone-crushing gravity wave.
flavor: "Too impractical, and it has no style. People will go back to explosions before long, trust me." -- Laurie

events.name: The Ring of You Die
descriptions: Effect: You Die.
You really need to stop use-identifying items.
And you thought you were smart for saving a casting of Identify on one ring.
flavor: "Thank the gods it wasn't The Ring of Everyone Dies." -- Mulcahy

texts: That hurt, but didn't quite kill you.

events.name: Arcane Waste Container
descriptions: This dangerous magical leftover substance is flooding the area with thaumaturgons and other imaginary particles.
A hazardous substance left over from magical experiments, it radiates imaginary particles with very real negative effects.
This extremely toxic sludge is the unfortunate side-effect of ultimate arcane power, normally buried underground for millenia.
flavor: "Don't let the dwarves near it. They'd probably try to drink some." -- Ralford

texts: Run past; how bad can it be?

events.name: Unnamed Eldritch Abomination
descriptions: It has no name because nobody has ever seen it and lived. So as long as you don't look at it, you'll be fine, right?
No one has ever seen it and lived to tell the tale, so just make sure to keep your back to it and fire over your shoulder.
The sight of it drives mortals mad, so be sure to use bank shots and blind-fire around corners to get it.
flavor: "If it catches you, fight to the last. Not for heroics, but because death is easier for me to fix than insanity." -- Neville

texts: Try to escape with some sanity intact.

events.name: Rube Goldberg Trap
descriptions: A giant mace knocks you down some stairs, which turn into a slide, launching you off a ramp into a pool of acid.
A piston in the wall knocks you through a false panel, and dumps you into a vat of acid above a pit of lions.
A floor plate launches you into the air, where a swinging beam knocks you into a vat of acid suspended by a burning rope.
flavor: "Just because your trap is unique, doesn't mean it's a good design." -- Erdan

texts: Just run past if you can.

events.name: Spring-Loaded Pressure Plate
descriptions: This trap launches YOU - into the ceiling.
Once intended as a quick way back to the upper levels, the ceiling hole is bricked up now, so watch your head. And feet.
Instead of bringing the ceiling down on you, this trap brings you to the ceiling at high velocity.
flavor: "I'm not sure what's more impressive - that the trap launched Talrath, or that he left a dent in the ceiling." -- Eleri

events.name: Flaming +3 Adamantium Caltrops of Piercing
descriptions: Somebody REALLY has it in for your feet.
What did your feet ever do to upset the dungeon architect so much?
Whoever laid these out must really hate your feet in particular.
flavor: "And of course there's an antimagic field to prevent us just levitating over them." -- Tavila

texts: Pick a path through the caltrops.
Grit your teeth and go through.

events.name: Napalm Trap
descriptions: Sprays an incendiary compound that was created to terrible effect during the Druidic Wars.
After the Druidic Wars came to a sudden and conflagratory end, this substance was banned from common use.
This inflammatory trap is a painful reminder of how the Druid Invasion was stopped, but at what cost?
flavor: "A spray nozzle, too! Your shields won't help. It's ingenious in a way that screws us over thoroughly." -- Tal'akh

events.name: Lightning Coil
descriptions: A marvel of dwarven engineering, mostly used to fry vermin in storehouses in dwarven cities with the power of 50,000 volts.
The invention of a mad dwarf who just really, really wanted to show the rats in his basement who was in charge.
The ultimate pest control, it's configured to shoot anything that moves with a lightning bolt that blinds anyone nearby.
flavor: "Listen, lad, if you'd seen the size of the rats we deal with, you'd know this isn't overkill." -- Volkur

events.name: Exploding Door
descriptions: Make even one mistake on the combination lock on this door, and kaboom! At least the resulting hole in the wall will let you pass.
The ornate combination lock on this door punishes even the smallest mistake with an explosion that will obliterate the door itself.
The passage this door conceals is rarely used, as any small mistake on the combination lock will blow open the whole wall.
flavor: "Such a trap works better on heroic types - evil's legions would happily sacrifice a minion to open the way." -- Avaris

events.name: Bank Vault Door
descriptions: There's no way you're ever getting through this door, so you might as well just bust through the wall next to it.
No, you're not breaking through this door. However, the sandstone brick wall next to it might work better.
Solid adamantium, reinforced with every Abjuration imaginable. You've got better odds smashing the wall next to it.
flavor: "Sorry, pal. Even a running start, mithril cleats and a bunch of buff spells wouldn't let me kick this door down." -- Rick

texts: Break the wall next to the door.

events.name: Boulder Pushing Puzzle
descriptions: Pushable blocks weren't bad enough, apparently. Someone had to up the ante.
Unlike puzzle-approved pushing blocks, these boulders aren't made to be shoved around.
These boulders, once pushed, keep rolling until they hit something, making this puzzle more annoying.
flavor: "Ohh... Vikari knew Vikari should have learned to play golf." -- Vikari
"Put your hammer down, Vikari. This isn't a sport, you'll just end up crushing one of us." -- Talrath

texts: Gather everyone to roll the boulders.
Push the boulders as a team.

events.name: Cave-In
descriptions: Some previous overzealous adventurer knocked down a load-bearing column.
This room is completely blocked off by fallen sand and gravel. Did you bring a shovel?
This room has been filled with its own ceiling plus the contents of several rooms above it.
flavor: "Don't look at me. The only tunnels I dig are knife wounds into peoples' organs." -- Kirak

events.name: Underground River
descriptions: This natural cave feature is annoyingly wide and even more annoyingly long.
Too swift to swim across, too wide to jump across, nature has never been so annoying.
You can barely see the riverbank on the other side; even a grappling hook throw won't reach.
flavor: "This would be a good spot to rest if the fate of Cordan wasn't hanging in the balance." -- Ralford

texts: Make an ice bridge with magic.

events.name: Cursed Staircase
descriptions: You're not sure how, but you just walked down a flight of stairs and ended up at the top floor.
So far you have found two different bottoms of this staircase and you reached both by going up the stairs.
This staircase seems to go on forever, but every time you turn and look behind you you're still at the bottom.
flavor: "At least all these stairs are going to keep me in good shape." -- Mac

texts: Keep going until you get through.
Just keep going until you're through.

events.name: Rune of Stop Time
descriptions: This rune locks you in a temporal bubble for a while. Hope you brought some cards or dice with you.
Freezes you in a temporal bubble, and inverts the color of everything nearby to hurt your eyes.
Removes you from the timestream for a bit, leaving things to carry on without you while you get bored.
flavor: "It'sss not my fault that I brought a book of puzzlesss to passss the time, and you didn't. Buzz off." -- Mardak

texts: Wait for it to wear off.

events.name: Giant Pit Full of Treasure
descriptions: There's no way you can possibly carry it all out... so why not take the opportunity to swim in it for a while?
Come on, when else are you going to get the chance to actually swim through gold coins?
Normally this much loot has a dragon on top of it; you'll never carry it out, so time to go swimming.
flavor: "Vikari has that hungry look in his eyes. I'm not going to pull him away from it, are you?" -- Lyndra

events.name: The Devil
descriptions: Just look at all these amazing deals available, right here, right now! Act fast, this is a limited time offer!
Lucifer here with some FANTASTIC deals for you. You won't believe the kind of value you can get for your old, used soul!
Satan himself has offered you this deal, that's how you KNOW it's good!
flavor: "Ugh, not again! I told you to put me on the 'Do Not Tempt' list!" -- Wyatt

texts: Banish him back to the lower planes.

events.name: Deepest Darkness
descriptions: Lanterns, torches, and the humble Light spell have got nothing on this.
Light, Continual Light, and Maximized Light are all equally ineffectual in this magical darkness.
A magical darkness that swallows up all light, short of the fire of a thousand suns.
flavor: "The shadows are my friend, but I need at least a little light to have shadows." -- Kirak

texts: Feel along the wall to get through.

events.name: Non-Euclidean Labyrinth
descriptions: If you squint and look into the distance, you can see your party members standing on the ceiling.
The right-hand rule takes you up two floors, and jumping through a hole puts you on the ceiling.
Trying to backtrack is impossible, and instead takes you in a new, exciting direction you didn't know existed.
flavor: "The only consistent thing about this labyrinth is that nothing about it makes sense." -- Mac

events.name: Patented Lock
descriptions: This revolutionary new multi-tumbler helix lock renders your door unpickable*! (*Terms and conditions apply)
The maker of this lock claims it is Unpickable, with a tiny asterisk after it.
The maker of this 'unpickable' lock has promised a reward to anyone who can pick it, and then meet him alone in a dark alley.
flavor: "Too bad 'dis thing is such a pain to use that even if we had the key, it wouldn't speed this up any." -- Wyatt

texts: Give up and go another way.

events.name: Conveyor Floor Room
descriptions: The horizontal version of running up a down escalator; at least it'll be some good exercise.
One mis-step and you'll get carried elsewhere, and never where you want to go.
A maze of magical conveyors that prevent you from simply running across them, because that would be too easy.
flavor: "The only future I see in this room is a lot of headaches and annoyances." -- Lyndra

texts: Ride conveyors until you get lucky.

events.name: Dark Elven Architecture
descriptions: The room is magically darkened, the floors are black stone, the walls are dark steel, and somewhere in here is a secret door.
This room holds a secret door, concealed among obsidian tiles, black steel pillars, and no lighting whatsoever.
Dark steel walls with black stone flooring is all the rage among the dark elves, as is putting a secret door in the wall and removing all light sources.
flavor: "You'd think having Darkvision would help with this, but trust me, it really doesn't." -- Kirak

events.name: Water Level Raising/Lowering Puzzle.
descriptions: Sigh.
It had to be one of these, didn't it.
Oh no, not one of these!
flavor: "Could be worse, mate, I've seen whole temples full of these things." -- Aussei

texts: Take another path, no matter how long it takes.
No. We're not doing this. Let's go another way.

events.name: Steampunk Power Generator
descriptions: This entire machine's one purpose is to open a door, but it's a door that's two feet thick and made of adamantium.
Repairing this machinery is your only hope of opening the adamantium door that even the Knock spell cannot hope to budge.
Someone managed to build a door so ridiculously oversized that this machinery is the only thing that can open it; get fixin'.
flavor: "I sure hope no-one had to get out of this place in a hurry." -- Davey

texts: Give up and go a different way.

out_of_time_messages: You are out of time! The Omnimental has gathered enough power to escape the dungeon.
You have run out of time! A wave of power rips through the dungeon, signaling the Omnimental's escape.
The Omnimental has escaped the dungeon! You have taken too long to attempt to stop it.
cure_messages: You cure some small wounds with a little bit of divine magic.
A light curing of wounds heals some of the damage you have taken.
A few words of divine magic cure some small wounds.
mass_cure_messages: Everyone's wounds are healed with a divine invocation.
The whole party is healed a bit by a surge of divine magic.
With some words of divine power and a gesture, the party's wounds are healed.
out_of_health_messages: You are forced to fall back and retreat to heal your wounds.
The party has taken too many wounds; you are forced to retreat and heal.
The extent of your wounds forces you to retreat to a safe place and heal.
restart_messages: Suddenly the dungeon collapses.
The dungeon explodes.
The dungeon implodes.
And then everybody died.
Rocks fall; everyone dies.
You all have an aneurysm.
You all have a heart attack.
You all suffer a fatal nosebleed.
You all forget to breathe.
Your party realizes that they are merely characters in a video game, and refuse to continue.
Your party suffers a critical existence failure.
A dragon eats the party.
A dragon steps on the party.
A dragon falls on the party.
You are eaten by a grue.
A stone block falls on your head! You die...
Your party spontaneously combusts.
You have died of dysentery.
And then it turns out that it was all a dream.
And then the dungeon collapsed? Come on, uncle, tell us what REALLY happened...
Wait, no, that's not how it went. Let me start over from the beginning.
short_rest_messages: The party takes a few minutes to catch their breath and eat a few snacks.
The party pauses to take a snack break in a cleared room.
A short break rejuvenates your party and reminds them how tasteless trail rations are.
enter_dungeon_messages: Diabolical forces have opened portals to the elemental planes within an ancient dungeon. It falls to whatever adventurers are nearby to close these gates and defeat the Omnimental before it can gather enough power to escape the dungeon and devastate the world above.

Local adventurers have unearthed a plot to unleash an Omnimental upon the lands of Cordan. Before the Omnimental can escape, the Heroes must venture into the dungeon the portals are in, close them, and defeat the Omnimental.

A group of adventurers has broken through evil's legions at the entrance to a dungeon. While the rest hold the line, four of them must delve into it, close elemental portals, and defeat the Omnimental before it gathers enough power to escape and wreak havoc upon Cordan.

Some adventurers out dungeon crawling have stumbled on a scheme to unleash an Omnimental upon the lands of Cordan. For lack of anyone better in the area, these adventurers must now close the elemental portals and defeat the Omnimental, or there won't be a civilization left for them to sell their loot to.
long_rest_messages: The party stops in a safe location to tend to their wounds and make a pot of tea.
A long rest gives the party time to heal their wounds and make a quick meal.
After a long rest period, with wounds tended and bellies full, the party is ready to resume their adventure.

heroes.flavor: Hailing from the frozen north and wearing thick furs over their muscles, the berzerker excels at fighting, punching things, and breaking stuff.
heroes.name: Vikari
heroes.quote: Tiny dungeon monsters will regret not running in fear!

heroes.flavor: Sworn to the service of a noble order dedicated to keeping the peace in the realms, the knight is trained in combat prowess and polite conversation.
heroes.name: Talrath
heroes.quote: Those that stand in our way shall be swept aside.

heroes.flavor: War mages read as many books on strategy as they do books of spells, and use the voice of a drill instructor to chant their spells.
heroes.name: Laurie
heroes.quote: The proper application of arcane might can tip the scales in any battle.

heroes.flavor: Born with the gift of arcane power, those who manage not to blow themselves up in their youths become fearsome, if squishy, combatants.
heroes.name: Eleri
heroes.quote: Nothing in this dungeon can withstand the full force of my power.
